I did it ! Congratulations to me! Finally... now I can sleep peacefully. Heh! Just a thought. No wonder people say that even if you have been friends with someone for a long time, you will still learn new things about that person. I've been with him for 6 years and we've really been through a lot together. BUt it has been a great learning experience and all those ups and downs have, in their own special ways, helped to strengthen the bond and feelings that we share. He's one person I am really comfortable with ... as he knows my character inside out and I don't have to explain much. Simply because he knows.. Now , what's my point? the point is I am finding it a little difficult to handle changes/ mood swings/ watever you call it with new friends. For the past ten years, I have only been close to two people -- my best friend and him. They are the only ones who know me well enough to predict my future actions, to know when to keep away and leave me alone.. blah blah....could it be that because of this, I've lost that skill to handle differences with new friends? Don't get me wrong... I can get along easily and pretty well with people...just that sometimes frustration gets to me when I can't understand the rationale behind some of their actions. Of course not everything can be rationalized.... but it just gives me headaches sometimes. I guess this would just be another learning journey. :-) okies....back to work. I am to finish three piles of test papers over the weekend. .. good night all.

Pretty bored with the lecturer so I decided to update the blog. Anyway, back to school.... Had a fulfilling lesson with one of my sec 3 classes. the class consists of a bunch of restless students.Most of the time, they can't keep still. ALways need to chit chat a little, then do some work... play around a bit then back to work. Just now was splendid . I decided to be in a bad mood so I stepped in with a black face. Taught for abt 20 mins then made them do exercise. Told them they can't go home if they can't finish...I even locked the doors...haha..it worked. But one guy tried to play a fool and wanted to bring his work back with the excuse that school was ending....Stayed back with him until he finished it....:-P SOmetimes I wonder what they come to school for if they just want to be lazy. I don't remember being like that last time....or should I ask my teachers first before claiming anything? There's no major concern on my mind at the moment. just work. boring? yeah, I think so too. I'm boring myself to death ( is that correct structure? heck. who cares...)
